newsitem.title: USA: CME November lumber ends higher, deferreds lower.
newsitem.headline: CME November lumber ends higher, deferreds lower.

text.p: CME November lumber futures closed higher after briefly trading up the $10.00 per-thousand-board-foot daily limit this morning.
Bull-spreading with November impeded gains in January, while taking November to a contract high of $415.00 per tbf, they said.

Demand for deliverable lumber supported November. Talk continued to circulate that exports from Canada will slow because of quota constraints. As a result, mills and dealers appear to be buying the futures to cover sales commitments.
Also underpinning the November were concerns excess wood chip supplies may force some sawmills to cut production.
Lumber closed up $6.80 to down $2.50 with November up the most at $411.80.
